page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: Our traffic survey recorded cars, buses, vans and lorries, motor cycles and bicycles. We counted 347 cars passing through one main road in only half an hour.We talked to some people to find out what kinds of transport they used and for what purpose. Most people in the area had their own car and some of these thought they were cheaper to run than to use public transport. The people who used public transport were not satisfied. They thought they had to wait too long for buses and that fares should be cheaper Everybody interviewed thought the roads were in poor condition.Trains and cars were thought to be more reliable than buses. People mainly used public transport for visiting, or shopping. many people travel by bus to Croydon or by train to London to go to work.
